attributes.action: Recourse when Government Policy causes harm
attributes.additional_details: If the policies of the current Government lead to the death of more than twenty persons or injury of more than 20 persons, the Government will scrap the policy and step down. Causation factors are those that fall under policies that fail to meet the needs of individuals, allowing them to die or suffer harm/injury to their health. In the case of deaths being attributed to any Government policy, the Government heads who were responsible for the policy being implimented will face manslaughter charges.
